You're sick man. Mentally ill. A beautiful black woman named CYNTHIA suddenly steps into view. She talks to Jack above the music.
Jack, Jerry Haggerty just called. Jack winces.
He says he’s got another business deal for you.
Sure he does. What kind of business?
He didn’t say. He just wanted to know if you could meet him in Vegas. Jack mulls it over in his head.

Haggerty was the lawyer who did all the business for the nightclub. In almost no time I had turned the place around. I'd fired everyone who'd been robbing the club. I suspected he was the biggest crook of all, but couldn't really prove it.  50 51 52 31.
A limousine driver holds up a sign "JACK HARRIS". Jack nods hello and heads into his limo. INT. — LIMOUSINE - DAY 51 Jack sits in back, on the phone.
Diana is on the other end. She’s with her housekeeper, LAURA, her sons MICHAEL, about ten, and Adam, about three, and Laura's son, ALEJANDRO, also about three.
(into phone) When are you coming home, baby? Its been a few weeks, again.
(into phone) I’m not sure yet. Believe me I want to be there, I just can’t right now. Diana looks at Michael.
I know you’re working hard, I just think you’re missing so much...
I know. Believe me, I know.
Maybe I could sneak away for the weekend. I’ll fly out to LA.
No, don’t. Right now I’m in Vegas.
Vegas? What for?
Jerry Haggerty invited me here.  53 32.
Oh Jack, that creepy lawyer from the club? He's nothing but trouble.
He says he’s got some business venture. And if it wasn’t for him, I wouldn’t have the night club. And that’s turning out more than okay. It saved our ass baby.
He’s slimey. Be careful.
Alright, I know, you're right...but at least I might get some laughs out of it.
What starts with laughter ends in tears. Jack laughs.
I love you, baby.
Love you too.
JERRY HAGGERTY is driving a golf cart with Jack at his side. Jack just sits there listening to Haggerty and his bullshit.

I keep snap hooking everything. This fucking golf pro told me that all great players fight a fucking hook. Now he’s got me hitting everything into the fucking woods, and my handicap’s gone up five fucking points.
Aside from your golf game, you must be doing pretty well, Jerry. Its not like you to pay for a plane ticket.
Oh, I’m doing great, Jack. I’ve got all kinds of deals going on.  54 55 56 33.
So what "deal” do you have for me?
I‘1l tell you a story you won’t believe.
Of course you will.
Really. I’m not kidding. It’s like “The Treasure of Sierra Madre” meets the “Twilight Zone”.

INT. — HARD ROCK HOTEL, SUITE - NIGHT 54 Buck and Wayne look frightened and bloodied up from some kind of beating. They also look as if they’ve been up for days partying. Buck is on the phone yelling, while Wayne paces in the background, chain smoking.

Okay. I get a call from a friend that there’s these two guys are holed up ina suite at the Hard Rock and need some of legal advice. They started this business, but have no idea what they’re doing. INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL, SUITE - A DIFFERENT NIGHT 55 Buck and Wayne are partying with a bunch of GORGEOUS HOOKERS. They appear to be having the time of their lives.

A couple of months ago they make a whole bunch of money, like a million bucks, and they come out to Vegas. Start partying for weeks. From what I understand, they go through a pound of blow, hit every hooker in town, and now, they can’t pay their partners.
Haggerty hooks a shot with Jack watching.  57 34.
See, what did I tell ya'? Everything's left and in the fucking weeds.
Who are their partners?
A bunch of Russians in LA. Nikita something.
Sokoloff?
Yeah, that’s him. You know him?
Yeah, he shakes down a lot of night club's, along with everything else in LA. I've been lucky enough to avoid him. He's a raving lunatic.
No argument there, Jack.

INT. — HARD ROCK HOTEL, SUITE - NIGHT 57 Nikita is in the hotel suite, with several of his RUSSIAN MOB SOLDIERS. One of them is his nephew, IVAN, a particularly large, evil brow, son of a bitch. He is beating the crap out of Buck with a belt wrapped around his fist.
They were kicking the shit out of these guys because they couldn’t pay up like they were supposed to.
Stop it! You’re gonna kill him! Ivan takes out a gun and puts it in Wayne’s mouth. Wayne’s eyes WIDEN.  35.
These morons blew through all their money. So they went to my friend for help who came to me. And now I come to you.
Come to me for what?
To fix the problem, what else? Look, from what I understand, this business they’ve started is a real cash cow, Jack.
If it’s such a cash cow, what do you need me for?
Because Jack, it could be a herd.
What is the business?
This is the best part. All they do is put a bunch of dirty pictures on the Internet. I’m telling you, inside a couple of months, they made over a million bucks.
I got a wife and kids. I’m not getting involved with porn, Jerry. Haggerty points to several surrounding hotels on the strip.
Hey, let me ask you a question. You think Steve Wynn or Baron Hilton are pornographers?
No...of course not.
Well they got all that shit playing on their TV’s, in all their hotel rooms. You name a hotel chain, they’re making money off of porn. Are they all pornographers? (MORE)
59 Jack stare Off Jack's 36.
I’m not asking you to make porn movies, Jack. I’m asking you to straighten out a business situation. s at Haggerty.
Hey Haggerty, these guys are animals. I’m not getting into the middle of this. No way.

Just go meet with the guys. What's the harm in that? You can fix anything, this needs fixing, and maybe you could make a couple of bucks. face... INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL, CASINO - DAY 59 Jack is greeted by RICHARD WILK a casino executive at the door, Jack and Richard move across the crowded floor. Jack nods,
Welcome to the Hard Rock Mr. Harris, I’m Richard Wilk, anything you need. (handing Jack his card). I arranged what you asked. (Richard reaches in his coat pocket and hands Jack and ENVELOPE)
Thanks Richard. What suite number?
The Bowling Alley. walk away.

Haggerty. I was sure his big plan was to have me fix the Russian problem, get the business up and running and then figure out a way to rip it off. Knowing Haggerty, he already had that part figured out. He was already being investigated by the feds, and stunk of desperation. If this was real, and I was going to get involved, he could not be a part of this, no matter what.

60 61 62 37. INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL, SUITE - DAY 60 We're back in the hotel suite. Buck and Wayne are partying, having a great time with the out call hookers. Haggerty is off to the side, supplying the coke. INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL, HALLWAY - DAY 61

From what Haggerty told me I knew there was a lot of money in this deal. And that was good. The money was in porn. And that was bad. Why I even knocked on that door is beyond me. Jack knocks on the door to the suite. He hears rustling on the other side.
Who is it?

Jack Harris. The door opens. Buck checks him out and pulls him inside. INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL, SUITE - DAY 62 The place is enormous. It looks like a bomb hit it, filled with room service carts, and piles of cigarette butts that spill out everywhere and onto the floor. It’s real “Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas” type stuff. Wayne comes up behind Jack and tosses him into the wall, putting a gun to his head. He pulls back the hammer. Buck jumps in the way.
He’s okay! He’s okay! Wayne’s eyes are nearly bugging out of his head.

How do you know?!? How do you know?!? You don’t know what the guy looks like! Wayne starts patting Jack down. He takes Jack’s wallet and checks his ID. He looks at it, then tosses it back to Jack.  38.

Don’t mind him, he’s been up for eleven straight days. Jack turns and gets his first good look at Wayne. He is dressed only in a robe, which periodically opens up, his dick hanging out. This makes Jack visibly uncomfortable.
It doesn’t mean I don’t see things with clarity, man. I’m a sharp motherfucker! I’m sharp as a tack. These little fuckers are all over the hotel.
There aren't any little fuckers.
Oh, bullshit!
Little fuckers? What’s he talking about?
He’s nuts. He thinks there’s leprechauns in the hotel. Wayne rushes over, waving the gun around.

Little fuckers! Little fuckers with tiny, little assholes, that shit these little fucking hearts and clovers! I see them all over the place! Behind the cabinets! Under the fucking bed! And they’re listening devices man!
That’s Lucky Charms dumbass. Now shut the fuck up.
Guys, this room stinks. Jack looks at Buck.
You seem to be the brains of this outfit. You both need something to eat.
I know, he won’t let anybody else up to the room.  39.
Damn straight. We’ve got Russians after us. You don’t think they’ve got Russians working in the kitchen? They’1l poison the food, Right?...Right?...Am I Right?
I'll eat the food first. If it’s good, I‘1ll hand it over to you.
Bullshit. What if I get a bad bite?
He’s afraid we’re gonna get cracked. We owe these Russians money.
Whacked. Not “cracked”, whacked. Jesus. And you owe Nikita Sokoloff money, probably the last guy on Earth you’d ever want to fuck around with. What were you guys thinking?
I dunno. We weren’t. We just had all this money coming in. I mean, more money than we'd ever seen.
Why didn’t you just pay them? Wayne starts waving his hands around.
Bees! Bees man! Bees! You hear them swarming?!? They sound like they're swarming!...Right?
(re: Wayne) Shut the fuck up! And put your damn dick away! (To Jack) We were high. We figured, what’s the rush? I mean, everybody's friends, right?
No, not with these guys.
Fucking bees, man!  63 40.
Wayne, I am telling you for the last time. Shut the fuck up! I can’t hear myself think!

Fuck you, man -- Buck grabs a remote control, FIRES IT off Wayne's head. He charges him and TACKLES him to the floor. A gruesome sight as Wayne's robe is entirely open as they roll around. Jack's eyes BULGE. He then calmly gets out of his chair and grabs a champagne bucket, filled with melting ice water. He throws it on the two men, dousing them. The guys SHRIEK, roll off each other, out of breath.
Guys! Let's focus on why we're here. Jack sits in a CHAIR across from them, still on the floor. A beat.
We're so fucking dead, aren’t we?
No. But you’ve got to clean up. And tell me everything.

INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL, SUITE - DAY 63 It’s an hour later. There is a brand new room service cart there. Buck has clearly convinced Wayne to eat. The situation appears to be calming down, as Buck and Wayne do their best to explain everything to Jack.

The amazing thing to me was that they had started a business that already could have made more millions than I could imagine in such a short time. Instead of paying, they hid out in a hotel suite, and spilled more coke than most people were capable of doing in a lifetime. (MORE)
I figured that had they kept their shit together, for just the last two months, they might be worth millions. So maybe this wouldn’t be so tough to fix after all.
Look, you’ve got to take care of this Russian problem.

First of all, I don’t have to do a God damn thing. Got it? Buck and Wayne nod, like children. Alright. I need to figure out what you did right. Obviously something because you made a million bucks in two months. I know what you did wrong, you didn’t pay your partners. And based upon what I see here today, I can safely assume that you don’t have the common sense that Christ gave a cockroach, on how to run a business.
But you do, right?
Right.
So, will you do that for us?

Not so fast. I won’t make money by creating porn. I’ve got a family. I don’t have any interest in being a pornographer. If I’m going to come on, we will never provide porn again. (Thinking out loud) You guys figured out how to take a credit card from a person anywhere in the world and then deliver a product anywhere in the world, and neither side sees each other. Its genius, for sure. This is where the money is, long term. We just need to deliver the porn into homes all over the world, process the payment and take a cut.
What do you mean?  64 65 66 42.
I'm not sure I understand.
Imagine there's a basement, and in this basement there's a Chinese orgy...
INT. —- CHINESE ORGY - BASEMENT - TIMELESS 64 A room filled with ASIAN MEN and WOMEN, naked, getting it on. We see TWO ASIAN, yet Americanized MEN with spiky bleached hair filming...

And imagine you're guys who like to watch Chinese orgies...But how are you going to pay to see it? Are you going to give your credit card numbers to a group of Chinese pornographers overseas? And what would it show up on your credit card bill as...
The FARMER'S WIFE from the beginning montage opens the household credit card bill...
The Farmer's wife's face boils with rage. She turns and sees her HUSBAND in his overalls. She walks up behind him and smashes him across the head with a frying pan.
The divorce rate is high enough in this country without wives having proof that their husbands are spending money on filthyasianwhores.com.
INT. —- HARD ROCK HOTEL SUITE - SAME 66 Buck and Wayne are like two mesmerized children, staring at Jack like he's a genius.  43.
We could have hundreds of sites...maybe even thousands, all under some nondescript name?

Exactly, if I get a credit card bill and it says big tits dot com I may have some buyers remorse, but if it says software billing company, then who knows what that means. It’s safer for everyone concerned. Win / Win. Consumers get what they want, content providers get what they want and we make ten percent for handling the transaction.
Yeah, then we could take a cut from all of those people out there that are already making it. Be in the middle. Fucking middle men!
It's limitless man, God damn limitless!
Potentially. We have no downside, other than your Russian partners.
Where does Haggerty fit in?
I’m not so sure about Haggerty.
Why? He put us together. That would be kind of shitty to cut him out.
Look, he’s probably going to be indicted any time now. He’s got federal agents all over him.
He told us he was never even going to be charged.
This is already a questionable business. I don’t think it’s wise to team up with someone who is under investigation. We'll have federal agents all over us too.  67
Look, what you’re saying makes sense. But I just don’t feel right about it. This guy’s saving our life.
Get something straight. I’m saving your life. I’m the one that’s gonna have to deal with these Russians, not Jerry Haggerty.
Yeah but... Wayne looks at Buck, cuts him off.

Yeah, ok, fine. We’re on board with you a hundred percent. Partners, right? As soon as you take care of this Russian problem. EXT. —- HAGGERTY’S HOUSE - DAY 67 The house is nice, far from palatial, but well kept. Jack rings the doorbell. Haggerty appears in the doorway. Jack slaps an envelope in Haggerty’s hand.
What’s this?
Two hundred thousand dollars. Now you’re out.
Hey, wait a minute...
Then I’m out. Give me back the money.
No, no. Wait.
What’s it gonna be?

Alright, alright, I'll take the money. Jack nods and heads back to his car. Haggerty quickly takes half the money and shoves it in his pocket as he closes the door.  68 69 70 71 45. INT. - HAGGERTY’S HOUSE, LIVING ROOM 68 Haggerty crosses the living room and heads for the kitchen. INT. —- HAGGERTY’S HOUSE, KITCHEN - DAY 69 Ivan, the Russian who put the gun in Wayne’s mouth, sits at the kitchen table. He sips a vodka.
So?
He cut me out. Can you believe that shit? What a prick...how could he do that shit to a person? I mean, I knew he would, but it’s just so shocking when people are greedy like that.
What did he give you?
A hundred thousand.
Jack pulls up outside the club in his car.
The next morning I flew back with Buck and Wayne agreeing that I was on board. Jack parks the car. He gets out heading for the club.

The deal was that we wouldn't provide a frame of content ourselves. We were just going to be middle men. INT. — CASABLANCA -— DAY 71 Jack disables the alarm. He makes his way through the empty club over to his office.  72 73 74 46.

I told them to have Sokoloff contact me. These idiots didn’t even know how much they owed. Sokoloff’s guy called me and said it was a million bucks. INT. —- CASABLANCA, JACK'S OFFICE - DAY 72 Jack enters. There is a wall safe. He goes to it and opens it.
And they wanted it paid in three installments of four hundred thousand dollars. Inside is cash, lots of cash. At least a million dollars. He empties about half of it into a bag.
That’s more than a million bucks where I come from, but who was I to argue? Jack closes the safe and walks out.
Jack walks out of the club, the money bag under his arm.

I remember feeling pretty good that morning. Maybe this was going to be the answer to my dreams. Diana and the kids would never have to worry about money again. And I would absolutely be out of this business in one year. It would be a tough year I thought, but the result would be worth it. Jack gets into his car and takes off. EXT. —- SAN PEDRO, CALIFORNIA - DAY 74 Various shots of the coast of San Pedro.  75 76 47. EXT. —- JACK’S SAN PEDRO HOUSE - DAY 75 It's a beautiful place that overlooks the ocean. Ivan pulls up to the house in his black Mercedes. He gets out of his car and heads for the door.
Within an hour, some big Russian named Ivan was at my front door. Jack lets Ivan into the house.

location: JACK'S SAN PEDRO HOUSE, LIVING ROOM

text: The interior of the living room has an upscale beach house feel. Wayne and Buck sit on the sofa looking very nervous. Ivan instantly locks eyes with them.
Would you like a drink?
I’m not here to socialize.
I’m just trying to be friendly.
We are no fucking friends. Where is my money?
Your money? You mean Nikita’s money, don’t you?
He’s my Uncle. Our money. Family money that these two shit heads owe us. You pay this to me. Ivan glances at a framed photo of Jack and his son Michael.

Or maybe I take this little boy for boat trip, no? Ivan picks up the picture frame. Jack clenches his jaw with contempt.  48. Jack opens the blinds to the deck revealing James, REGGIE and PEANUT with his very large, African American "wrecking crew". They stroll into the living room and quickly have Ivan surrounded.
Maybe I speak out of turn.

Let's focus on why we're here. Jack drops a duffel on the coffee table. Ivan picks it up. It’s stuffed with many packets of hundreds. Ivan does a quick count of a single packet. He scans the packets, counting, his lips moving as he WHISPERS NUMBERS IN RUSSIAN. Ivan nods, and then smiles.

Okay. This is good. Deal. Ivan reaches out his hand. They shake. As they shake hands, from out of nowhere, James punches Ivan square in the nose. We hear a crunch, blood flies everywhere. Ivan barely blinks as blood runs down his face.
James...what the fuck?
He threatened Michael. Peanut hands Ivan a bar towel.

Good punch. Now everybody is friends. Let us have that drink. Everyone starts LAUGHING and they head over to the bar. Buck and Wayne end up laughing along with Ivan...Ivan puts his arm around Wayne's shoulder. Jack grabs his cordless phone, hands it out to Ivan.
Maybe you should call your boss. Tell him that everything has been settled. Ivan looks reluctant.  49.
This is okay. If I am happy. He is happy.

It's a lot of money. I'm sure he'd like to know it's been collected. And I think it would make my partners sleep better. Ivan takes the phone. He swallows hard, nervously. Jack stares at him skeptically for a moment. Ivan dials...puts the phone to his ear. After a moment Ivan suddenly relaxes.
It is machine. Ivan clicks off the phone and extends it back to Jack.

Oh. I guess we'll try again later. As Jack grabs the phone he feels it is wet. Jack looks down and sees his fingers are stained with blood. So is the phone. Jack looks up at Ivan. Blood is trickling down from Ivan’s ear. Jack is suddenly terrified, even though Ivan seems to be doing very well with his arm around Wayne.
I like you! You always make me laugh! We're friends now.

Yeah, we're friends, right! Right? Jack nudges James and motions with his chin towards Ivan’s ear. James’s face changes instantly. As Ivan is talking to Wayne, his eyes roll up in his head. He begins to slur his words as blood and puss pour from his ear. He collapses to the floor, foaming from the mouth. His right leg kicks violently, smashing the coffee table to bits. Wayne stares in shock.
Oh, Jesus Christ!
What the fuck did you do, Wayne?!? Jack and James rush over and check his pulse.  77 78 50.
Is he dead? James nods "yes".
How hard did you punch him?!?
I don’t know, Jack. I just punched ‘em like I always punch ‘em!
You ever hear of a jab?!?
Oh shit. We are so dead... We're dead, right? I mean, am I right?
Shit, I'm sorry Jack. Jack says nothing.
What are we gonna do?

Jack, James, and Peanut are tossing Ivan'’s body, wrapped in a large tarp and chains, off the port bow. Jack is clearly white as a ghost. Buck and Wayne peer on from across the deck, like two petrified children.
James is driving the boat back towards the lights of San Pedro. He and Peanut take pulls on a bottle of Hennessey.
Down below, Jack is drinking too, staring off into space, listening to the sounds of the engines. Buck sits across from him at the table, while Wayne paces in the background.
What do we do?  51.
We don’t do anything. We don’t mention this to anyone. Ever.
What about the money?
We gave it to him.
Yeah, but he’s dead.
But they don’t know that. And that’s the way we need to keep it.
Dude, you're not getting it. You’re just not getting it. They didn’t get their money.
As far as we're concerned, they did.
What are you talking about?!?
We gave them the money. He disappeared with it. End of story.
But what if they still want it?
We do what we would do in that circumstance. We tell them to fuck off.
Oh, no, no, no. These Russians are nuts, man. They’ve kicked our asses twice already.
I say we just pay them.
No! We're not going to pay them twice!
But we didn’t even pay them once!  79 80 81 52. Jack erupts.
They don’t know that! If we’re too eager to pay again, they’1l smell a rat! They’11 know we did something to him!
How do you figure that? Just pay them and they’1ll go away!
Yeah, it’s not like you can’t afford it. You still have the money...Right? Jack gets up.
Look, I've made it as clear as I know how. We’re done talking about this.
The plane touches down on the runway.
A town car pulls into the driveway. It stops and Jack gets out of the back, carrying his bag. The car pulls away. He stares at the place like it’s a sight for sore eyes.
Jack enters. The house looks much as we last saw it. Diana appears with open arms.
Hey honey. Jack hugs her, a little longer than usual. She picks up on it. She pulls back and stares him in the eyes.
Are you okay? He breaks the hug.  53.
Yeah. I missed you so much.
So what's this new business in California?
Never mind that right now. Jack’s children, Adam and Michael, run into the room.
Daddy! The kids run and attach themselves to Jack.
Hey gang. Jack looks to Diana.
Let’s go out to dinner tonight.
Where to?
Anywhere you want.
This fancy restaurant sits on the banks of the Gulf of Mexico.

We follow a WAITER who carries a tray of seafood and fish to Jack's table. At the table is Jack, Diana, Adam and Michael. The waiter sets the food down before them. Jack stares blankly at his broiled fish, the head still attached. He turns away, clearly having a bad thought. Looking out at the Gulf doesn’t help. He’s suddenly a million miles away.
You sure you're okay?
I’m fine.  54. Jack glances over to Michael, who is dumping ketchup on his french fries. It looks like blood. Jack takes a breath.
Daddy, what do fish eat?
Some eat plankton, some eat other fish.
They eat whatever’s around. ANGLE ON JACK, his mind is racing.
A SCHOOL OF RAVENOUS FISH ARE HAVING A BUFFET ON IVAN’S

head_text.subj: FACE. THEIR FISH TAILS WAGGLE AS THEY DINE ON HIS

text: Jack! Are you sure you’re okay?

Yeah, I’m just not that hungry. 85 INT. - JACK’'S MODEST HOUSTON HOUSE, BEDROOM - NIGHT 8 Jack and Diana lie in bed. It’s late. Diana stirs, coming out of a troubled sleep. She doesn’t even have to look at Jack to know...
You're awake aren’t you.
Yeah...
I know you better than you know yourself. What is up with you?
Just business.
Are you sure?  55. There is a pause.
Look, I’m gonna have to go back in a few days. It's a very new business. Once I get it up and running, I promise you, I'll be spending most of my time at home.
I hope so. I'd hate to lose you to California.
It's one of these new Internet businesses...you know how it is.
Not really. I don't know anything about Internet businesses.
They just take a lot of commitment.
So do marriages. He nods, takes her hand. They kiss. Then passionately. INT. - JACK’S CAR - DAY 86 Diana is driving Jack to the airport.
So what kind of business is it?
I told you. It's an Internet business.
Yeah, I know. What kind?
It’s a billing service.
Oh. For what?
What do you mean?
What do you bill people for?  56.
Entertainment...
Oh? What kind of entertainment?
Movies, pictures and stuff... Diana looks at him skeptically.
You're not telling me something.
Fine. Adult movies. She laughs.
Yeah, right.
I’m not joking. She stares at him.
C'mon, Jack be serious...
I'm serious, Diana.
You're really not joking?
Relax, I’m not making porn movies. It’s an Internet billing service.
Internet billing service? I don't even know what that means, Jack. You bill people on their computers?
Yeah Diana, computers.
This is the stupidest thing I’ve ever heard.  57.
I think it’s the gold rush, Diana. It could set us up for life in less than a year.
Well, I think you're crazy and it’s completely disgusting. And I don’t want you doing it.
What about Steve Wynn or Baron Hilton? Are they pornographers because they have these films in every one of their hotels?
I don’t care about them, I care about you, Jack.
Diana, I'll be out in a year.
I don’t want you to be a part of this at all. Not even for a day.
Oh Diana, c'mon. We watch the damn things once in a while.
I don't care! This is disgusting, I don't like it, and I don't want you doing it! End of story, Jack.
Little did she know it was already too late... 87 EXT. -— GEORGE BUSH INTERCONTINENTAL AIRPORT - DAY 87 Jack gets out of the car. He kisses Diana, heads for the terminal.

I couldn’t back out now. I mean, I could just imagine the damage that Buck and Wayne would do on their own. They were the kind of guys who would get pulled over for a DUI and start confessing to some motorcycle cop about the murder. I had to keep an eye on them somehow. (MORE)
I'd either end up arrested, or worse yet, dead by the hands of the Sokoloff's. EXT. —- LAX RUNWAY - DAY 88 The plane touches down.
Jack walks out of the terminal. James is there, standing in front of a town car.

So I go back to LA with my wife’s words rolling around in my head. I’m not in town two minutes and the shit hits the fan. Nikita and a few of his goons stand by a waiting car. They motion for Jack. Jack eyeballs them and forces his best smile.
I knew if I didn’t play this perfectly, I'd be joining Ivan. Jack walks over to the Russians. James grabs his arm.
(quietly) I don’t like this.
It’s cool. James bends down to take Jack’s luggage, getting in his way. Jack puts a calming hand on James’s shoulder. James straightens up with the bag.
(quietly) I’m telling you, I don’t like this.
It’s alright, I'll go with them. I'll meet you back at the house. Jack turns and heads for the Russian’s car.
Well, this is nice...thanks.  90 91 59. Jack gets in the back seat with Nikita and the car pulls away.
REGGIE and PEANUT are in the back seat.
Fuck this. We're following him. James quickly peels away from the curb. INT. — NIKITA’S CAR - DAY 91
I hope you guys don’t take this the wrong way, but my guess is you didn’t do this just to be nice.
Tell me about Ivan.
Ivan...what about him?
What happened exactly?
I'm sorry. What happened with what?
Was he was at your house?
Of course he was at my house. Why?
Tell me what happened.
I’m not following you. We had a bunch of drinks. We laughed a lot. Then he left. Nikita nods.
Are you gonna tell me what’s up?
Ivan never got home.  92 60.
Okay. So he’s out partying somewhere. Nikita stares at Jack.
What? Hey, I gave him the four hundred thousand we agreed to, plus fifty for your troubles.
What?
Four fifty. I gave him four fifty.
The figure was two hundred.

They weren't sure if we would volunteer to help them. I think they were trying to figure out a way to force you into it, but they didn’t have anything compromising on you. She moves closer to him. They kiss.
This is crazy, huh? She keeps kissing him.
I mean, we’re gonna be like spies. Working for the government.

It was all so crazy. A twenty three year old porn star was about become a major component in George Bush’s war on terror. INT. —- SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES, MEN’S ROOM - DAY 132 Wayne is in the middle of stealing toilet paper, shoving it into paper bags. Buck is checking his nose to make sure there are no cocaine crumbs anywhere.

Unfortunately, Wayne and Buck were becoming increasingly convinced that they were entrepreneurs and no longer needed my guidance. Now what I didn’t know at the time, was that they had finally put together what Denny Z was up to with their new secret website.
Under eighteen? You mean over eighteen? Or barely eighteen? Or just eighteen? You heard wrong, right?
No. I saw it. These are underage girls, man.  133 134 90. Wayne freezes up. He’s clearly petrified.
Oh shit. That ain’t good, man. Jack is gonna kill us.
Kill us? We can go to jail for shit like this.
What do we do? I mean this is totally fucked, right?
Whatever we do, we just keep it cool. We say nothing. We’ll figure out something.
Wayne and Buck enter the office, trying to appear “cool”. The hot female RECEPTIONIST motions for them to come over.
Hey guys, the FBI is here. Wayne turns white as a ghost.
Wh...huh...what?
Yeah, they’re in there talking to Jack. INT. - SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES, JACK’S OFFICE - DAY 134 Allman and Romero sit across from Jack.
Terrorists?
That’s correct.
And Audrey?
Right.  gl.
We've noticed a pattern with their viewing. First, they prefer solo or girl on girl to hardcore. They’1l watch it, but they’re incredibly homophobic. Second, they enjoy sites with military themes.
Military themes?
Girls posing with guns and the like.
Okay.

So here is what the government is recommending. We recommend that Audrey open up a new section to her site under a separate payment plan. ANGLE ON the outside of Jack’s office. Buck and Wayne sneak up and begin listening in.
A portal.
We will then monitor the activity to that portal through you. We feel this will be most effective. ANGLE ON Buck and Wayne outside the office. They whisper to each other.
Oh shit, oh shit. What the fuck are we gonna do? We gotta do something. We gotta do something, right!
You're doing your country a great service.

So now these two idiots are convinced that the FBI and I are conspiring against them. Meanwhile, I have no fucking idea what’s going on with them. They go into a panic, and who do they go see...?  92.
Haggerty sits with Buck and Wayne on the patio of the restaurant which overlooks a golf course.

You know what pisses me off? Whenever you got problems you come running my way. If you got Russians that want to kill you, or you’re worried about the FBI because of some sixteen year old on your website, suddenly I’m your best friend.
It’s not like that.
Bullshit.
How bad is it?
Minors fucking on a website? Oh, that’s bad.
It's not like it’s kiddie porn. They’re not kids. It’s just that a couple of the girls are sixteen or seventeen or something like that.
I’m not so sure the government shares your gift of nuance. A minor’s a minor.
So what do we do?
You two knuckleheads should dump this Denny Z and get as far away from this as you can.
What? Your the fucking guy who introduced him to us...told us to get into business with him!
That I do not recall but it's really irrelevant now, isn't it?  93.
Well it's a little relevant, right?...Am I right? You brought this on us.
Gentleman, please...Nobody likes to have a finger pointed at them. I demand the same respect I show you jerk-offs.
How do we make this disappear, man?
Hey wait. Let’s not get too rash here. This website’s the hottest thing we've got going.
Well then keep the website and see what happens to you.
Hey look. We see more money from this than anything else.
Let me ask you something. How much are you two bozos worth?
I don’t know.
Yeah, it’s kind of hard to keep track when it keeps coming in, right?
Well what is it? Give me a ballpark. A hundred million?
Yeah, I guess something like that.
And you couldn’t cut me in for a slice of this?
Look, Jack said you were under indictment and he didn’t want the FBI all over us.  94.
Well that little plan didn’t work out too well, now did it? Buck thinks about this.
Let’s partner up.
Sure. What about Jack? You gonna talk to him about me?
We'll figure something out.
You'd better, and get rid of that fucking website. You don’t walk away from this, you're gonna get tagged, bagged and fagged in a federal prison. They nod. They reach over to shake hands.
Hey thanks for everything. You're a real friend.
Yeah, right?

But they didn’t get rid of the website. They were so fucking greedy and stupid, they couldn’t stand the thought of losing a million dollars a month. So they kept the site rolling without telling Haggerty.
Buck, Wayne and Haggerty are saying their good-byes.

Now you’re sure you’ve told me everything? I’m serious here, I don’t want to get blind sided by something and we all end up in court together. Wayne and Buck exchange glances.  137 138 139 140 95. HAGGERTY (CONT’D) I knew it. There’s something you didn’t tell me. Wayne and Buck glance at each other one more time and start talking.
EXT. — RENTAL CABIN CRUISER - DUSK 137 Buck and Wayne watch as Jack and the bouncers toss Ivan’s body overboard.
And before you know it, Buck and Wayne told Haggerty about the dead Russian...
We see Ivan’s body sinking to the ocean bottom.
Every last fucking detail about how one of my bouncers accidentally killed him.
Buck and Wayne finish their story. Off Haggerty’s smile...
Now this scumbag’s got me in the worst possible position. Fuck me... INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - DAY 140 Jack and Diana sit at the kitchen table in complete silence.
So, I guess we're talking about a divorce then, aren’t we?  96.
Well, we just can’t go on like this, Jack. I despise the hypocrisy.
I understand.
No. I don’t think you do.
Look, Diana, I’m still in love with you.
Oh bullshit...
I am. You’re the one that pushed me out.

I pushed you out? You pushed yourself out. You jumped out. I don’t care how you spin it, disguise it, camouflage it, or homogenize it, you’re a flesh peddler and you disgust me. And I don’t want any part of it.
Yeah, just the hundred million dollars please.
Oh, you really make me sick.
Bullshit. You feel okay taking it because it’s one step removed from you. Somehow that makes it all okay?
Yeah, in my mind that’s just fine.
Well then you're using my argument against me. Who’s the hypocrite now, Diana?
Oh fuck you, don’t you get sanctimonious with me. You ruined my body with three children and then dumped me for some little, fucking whore.  141 142 Jack says nothing.
Well, if you think she’s fucking you good, wait till you see me in action. Jack looks at her. His body deflates.
Fine Diana, do whatever you want. I won’t argue with you. I know I’ve got it coming... He slowly turns and heads out.

So after that lovely scene, I headed back to LA. INT. — JACK'S SAN PEDRO HOUSE - BEDROOM - MORNING 97. 141 Jack and Audrey are in bed, her head on his chest. Jack’s cell phone rings. Jack picks up the phone.
vean? (into phone) eah? INT. — JACK'S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT Diana is on the other end of the phone. She’s upset.
Our son has been arrested!
Jack sits up.
What?
Our son has been arrested!
Why? What do you mean? What did he do?
I’m on my way. EXT. — PRIVATE JET - DAY 143 The jet sails through the air.
Jack is seated on the plane, staring out the window.

I was on my way to Houston within an hour. It turns out that Michael, my oldest son, didn't like a few of his grades so he hacked into the school's computer system and changed them to his liking. INT. —- DEAN'S OFFICE - DAY 145 Jack and Diana sit opposite DEAN LOOMIS, the headmaster of the school. They are both extremely animated.

So Diana and I went to see the head of the school, Dean Loomis. After some intense discussion and a generous donation towards the school's new gymnasium, we finally convinced him to drop the charges against Michael.
Jack is yelling into the phone. Diana sits nervously in the background.

But that wasn't enough. It turns out the Houston DA was looking to make an example of my son, and was proceeding with the charges regardless. EXT. -— HOUSTON CITY HALL - DAY 147 Jack walks into the building carrying a briefcase.  148 149 99.
So I decided to pay him a visit.
Jack walks past the secretary.
Excuse me. Do you have an appointment?
No. Jack goes into the office anyway, the secretary running after him.
Jack walks right in and sits down opposite the DA, FRANK GRIFFIN, briefcase at his side. The secretary comes in after him.
My name is Jack Harris. I believe we spoke on the phone earlier.
I'm sorry Mr. Griffin, he just walked past. Frank waives her off. She walks out of the office.
I'm not going to change my position Mr. Harris. Your son committed a serious crime and although he's still a minor, the state of Texas will prosecute him to the full extent of the law.
Look, Mr. Griffin, he's a kid. He dida stupid thing. I've severely reprimanded him for it. The school doesn't even want to press charges. Do we really need to go forward with this?
Mr. Harris, let me lay this out for you. I've got people, voters, upstanding citizens, who I am responsible to. I have to answer to them.  100.
And these people want to see my son tried for this?
Well maybe the acorn didn't fall too far from the tree. Jack shifts in his seat.
So that's what this is all about? This is more about me than my son?
Well, we both know what you do for a living. You deal in pornography.
I run a billing company.
But you still deal with pornography.
No more than any hotel chain. No more than any satellite or cable company. I'm just a middle man.
Look, I don't want to get into semantics. You're a pornographer. You peddle pornography over the Internet.
We're getting off the subject. (a delicious beat) Let's focus on why we're here. Jack picks up his briefcase. He opens it. He drops a stack of fax material onto Frank's desk.
What's this? Jack picks up one of the sheets and reads.

Youngtightpussy.com. Splendorintheass.com. Blacksonblondes.com. This is your billing record, Mr. Griffin.  150 151 101. The blood drains from Frank's face. Jack then produces a manila envelope from his briefcase. It's stamped and addressed to the Houston Chronicle.

Now God forbid this were to fall into the wrong hands and end up on the front page of tomorrow's paper. Can you imagine what that would do to a campaign in this nice, upstanding city? Especially to a man whose voter base is a bunch of good, God fearing Christian conservatives? I mean, that would be terrible. FREEZE FRAME: on Frank's face.
Needless to say, the charges were dropped.
The Software Billing private jet pulls up to the terminal. INT. - DIANA’S CAR - DAY 151 Jack and Diana sit, watching the jet pull up. They are both incredibly tense.
There’s a part of me that hates what you did to that man. But there is also a part of me that misses... She begins choking on her tears...
..-being protected by you like that. I’m so lost right now...I’m so angry...and I’m so confused. Jack turns to her.
Diana...
Please, get out. Jack nods and gets out of the car.  152 153 154 102. INT. — SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES - DAY 152 Jack heads down the hallway to JOSH POSNER’s office, one of his engineers.

I wasn’t back in LA ten minutes before the shit hit the fan. INT. —- SOFTWARE BILLING OFFICES, JOSH’S OFFICE - DAY 153 Josh's office is scarce, except for a calendar on the wall. He sits in front of his computer with Jack looking over his shoulder.
When I was looking for dirt on the DA I came across this website. It’s under Buck and Wayne’s domain, but it’s not billed by us.
It’s not billed by us? Then who the hell is it billed to?
You're not gonna like this.
Who?
Denny Z.
This is bad.
It gets worse.
Wayne and Buck sit in the conference room with Robin Swallow and Alexandra Raynes. They talk business, but one has the feeling one of their films could break out any point.  103.
We’ve found that the scenes where we are apart just do not hold the audience's attention.
We want to start a new series of films called, Sixty nine from behind. Suddenly, Jack bursts into the room. He zeroes in on Buck and Wayne.
Are you out of your fucking minds?!? Before they can react, Jack jumps across the table. Wayne is the closest. Jack grabs him by the throat and begins choking the life out of him.
Underage girls! Are you out of your fucking mind!?!
Relax Jack, relax! You're gonna kill him. Robin starts screaming.
Stop it! Stop it! Stop it! Jack releases his grip a bit on Wayne’s throat. Wayne fights to breathe.
We were gonna tell you Jack, I swear!
Yeah, we just didn’t know how.
We didn’t know that Denny Z fucked us, either! Jack shoves Wayne against the wall.
Where is he?
I don’t know.  155 156 104.
Where the hell is he?!?
I don’t know. We hardly talk. Maybe at that house they shoot at in the Valley. Jack storms out.
Jack screeches up in his Mercedes. We can hear thumping bass of the music coming from inside.
Jack enters. The place is dark. Lights flash. Music is blasting. In the hallway, paces away, is a couple fucking. Jack stares. He steps around them.

Jack heads into the living room. It’s a tangle of flesh. Close to twenty people fucking in all positions in the darkness and intermittent light. It’s like Dante’s Inferno. Jack moves through the crowds of sexual partners. He moves to the dining room. Couples are on tables. Chairs. Up against walls. He moves through the kitchen. More fucking. Couples play with whipped cream. Jack moves past them and back into the hall. More couples fucking. Everywhere. Jack opens a bathroom door. Two chicks are sucking a guy off. The guy waives and gives Jack a thumbs up. Jack turns. He moves back through the kitchen. Jack moves across the living room again, over to the staircase. He steps over bodies on the stairs. He makes the turn and heads for a bedroom. Inside the bedroom, is a melee of fucking, drinking and drug use. A pile of cocaine on the night stand. Jack backs out slowly. Almost apologetically.  157 105. He crosses the bedroom. Down the stairs. Down the hall to the backyard. Through the door. Outside is Denny Z talking to two pornstars. Jack grabs Denny Z.
Hey, what the hell are you doing? Jack begins beating the shit out of him. He keeps hitting Denny until he’s a bloody pulp. Denny spits blood out of his mouth.
You son of a bitch! I’1l fucking have you killed for this! Jack turns.

You'll do what? You’1l do what?!? Jack sees that Denny has a gun in his belt. Jack takes the gun away from Denny and fires a shot through Denny’s foot. Denny screams in agonizing pain. Jack tosses the gun and heads back into the house, leaving Denny screaming behind him. Jack goes back into the house. He heads back down the hall to the bottom of the staircase. Something catches his eye. He moves slowly back towards the living room. His face changes. It’s Audrey Dawn. She’s about to take on two guys in the middle of the floor. He stares. Jack leaves the house. INT. - JACK’S SAN PEDRO HOUSE, KITCHEN - NIGHT 157 Jack sits at the kitchen table, a glass of scotch in front of him...He's been drinking heavily and looks disheveled. Audrey enters the house and kicks off her shoes.  106.
Whew! Hard day at the office. Audrey heads towards the fridge. She pours herself a glass of wine and joins him at the table. Jack is incredibly quiet.
What’s up with you? Audrey sips her wine. She already know’s what’s up. Jack smiles...then LAUGHS almost maniacally.
I used to sit at a dinner table with my family.
Here we go...Is this old fashioned Jack?
Old fashioned? You think families are old fashioned.
I think family is overrated. A bunch of people sharing the same name, professing their endless love while destroying each other's dreams.
You are one twisted chick, know that? But I guess you'd have to be to end up at that house tonight getting double teamed.
I told you a million times Jack, I don’t dig guilt. Fuck guilt. Look at you...You're all about leveraging guilt. Maybe if I’m good over here, I can be bad over here. It’s destroying you.
Did it ever occur to you that maybe both of us have just switched off a part of our souls.
And what part is that?  107.
The part that’s supposed to question this kind of behavior.

You're not going to start moralizing, are you? Jack, you’ve made all this money because of all the horny, frustrated guys out there who have to jerk off because their wives and girlfriends don’t treat them right. So I become their little fantasy girl for five minutes a pop, and make them forget for a fleeting instant that their wives and kids can’t stand the fucking sight of them. No, I’m not going to feel guilty about that and my soul is perfectly in fucking tact. Jack says nothing.

You know what I’m starting to think? I’m starting to think that you’re full of shit! I don't need to be here...I really don't. Why, so you can get a call in the middle of the night from your bitchy wife that one of your spoiled kids may not be able to take part in the local regatta at some prep school homecoming! I don't need that in my life! I don't need you!
Your bags are already packed, Audrey. Audrey stops. Tears fill her eyes.
Really?...Why?
We don't belong anywhere near each other.
But...You make me happy.
Happy? You have another word? Audrey's face contorts with sadness and rage. She then throws her wine glass at Jack's face. He blocks it, cutting his hand...  108.
Fine! Not the first time I've had my fucking bags packed ya' know!
And it won't be your last. Audrey heads inside, wheels out TWO SUITCASES.
Don't bother to help me you piece of shit. Your a real gentleman!

Good news is, I won't feel guilty about it. She SCREAMS before heading out and SLAMMING THE DOOR so hard that one Jack's pictures falls off the mantle in the hallway and shatters. Jack gets up and walks to the hallway, locks the front door. On his way back he stops and picks up the broken picture frame... C.U. FRAME -- A younger Jack and Diana with their small children. Jack fights back his emotions...He walks with the broken picture out to his back deck...He takes a seat in a chair and just stares endlessly into the distant lights of San Pedro.

I came to the conclusion that I wanted out. I mean, desperately. I just didn’t know how. I caught myself doing something I hadn’t done in a long time. Praying. I was wondering if there was any good out there in the universe that could hear me, or if whoever it was decided a long time ago that I wasn’t worth listening to.
The sound of a ringing phone over black.
Jack jumps up from his sleep, grabs the phone.
Agent Allman walks to his car, on his cell phone.
Jack, it’s, Allman. I need to see you.
Can it wait till tomorrow?
It can’t wait an hour. Jack is taken a back.
Jack pulls into the lot. Allman is waiting for him, eating a hot dog by a long dock..
Allman was already waiting for me. I couldn't wait to hear whatever good news the government might have for me now. Allman gets in Jack's car.

You've been a stand up guy, Jack. As far as I’m concerned, the government owes you a lot. Two nights ago, several top ranking Terrorists were taken out in a fire fight in Afghanistan. Arrests were also made in Europe, Indonesia.

head_text.subj: AND ASIA. ARRESTS BEING MADE BY THE AUTHORITIES.

text: All told, nearly one hundred people rounded up...The least I could do, is warn you.
Warn me about what?
The government knows about some underage girls on your websites.  110.
Oh, Jesus...
No matter how you cut it, it’s child pornography, Jack. You'll be indicted, and trust me, you will go to jail.
I have nothing to do with that website.
I believe you. I really do.
Alright. What do I do with this warning?
Get out. Now. As fast as possible. Jack stares at Allman.
I can't. Allman looks at Jack for a moment and then pulls out a folder and opens it. He holds various mugshot pictures of Ivan...Then Nikita and his Goons.
Does it have anything to do with this? Jack stares at the PHOTOS and does everything he can to remain stoic.
One of your Ex bouncers was picked up on a drug charge two months ago. SINGLE SHOT: Peanut is cuffed against a car...
He told us Ivan Sokoloff, nephew of Nikita Sokoloff, was murdered in your living room five years ago.
161 EXT. —- JACK’S CABIN CRUISER - NIGHT 161 Ivan’s body splashes down into the water.  162 163 111.
He said you dumped the body off the coast of Catalina.
I've been in law enforcement a long time. I know when somebody's lying. His story was just a bit too linear for me to write off as bullshit.
I don’t know what you’re talking about.

I’m gonna tell you what I think happened. I think you got involved in this business hoping to make a few bucks and get out quick. I think you partnered up with a bunch of lunatics who you can’t trust because they’ve got this thing hanging over your head. I’1l tell you the truth Jack, I really don’t give a shit that Ivan Sokoloff is dead. I think the world’s better off without him. I really don’t want to arrest you on this child porn thing Jack, but I'll be forced to do that if you don’t figure a quick way out of this.
How the hell am I going to get out?
That’s not my problem. You just need to get out. Jack thinks on this. Allman gets out of the car.

Jack walks in. He’s clearly at the end of his rope. EXT. - JACK’S SAN PEDRO HOUSE, BALCONY - MORNING 163 Jack comes out onto the balcony, holding a half bottle of whiskey. He stares out as the sun rises over the harbor.  164 165 112.

I was asking myself, how could things get any worse? Jack picks up his cell phone. INT. -— JACK'S HOUSTON HOUSE - MORNING 164 Diana is on the phone. She’s hysterical. Her eye is swollen. She barely makes sense.
You son of a bitch! They took him! They took him!
What? Who? What are you talking about?
Your friends! Your disgusting friends!
INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - DAY 165 Several thugs wearing masks move through the house. Diana screams at the intruders.

I was now pretty damn sure that Wayne and Buck had somehow told Nikita about Ivan. One of the thugs punches Diana out. They begin moving down the hall. Laura the maid grabs her son, Alejandro, and begins running down the hall to hide.

But put Buck and Wayne in charge of something, and of course things won't go the way they are supposed to. One of the thugs comes out from behind Laura and tackles her. He grabs Alejandro and hands him off to the other thugs. Laura screams and screams in Spanish. (LAURA: Por favor senior, dame mi hijo! Por favor! Por favor!)  166 113.
Two Russian thugs bring Alejandro into the hotel suite. Buck and Wayne stare at the kid, each other, then turn to the Russian thugs.
What the hell is this?
This is boy.
Yeah? So?
This is boy from house.
What are you talking about?
Yeah. This ain’t Jack’s kid. This kid’s a fucking Mexican! Right?
What?
This isn’t Jack's kid! Look at him! He’s a fucking beaner, man!
What is beaner? This is boy from house.
(to kid) Do you speak English? Abla English kid? He doesn’t even speak English! You took the fucking maid’s kid! The Russian thugs look at each other.
What?
The maid! The maid! This is the maid’s kid!  167 168 169 170 114.
Yeah! Jack's kid’s not a Mexican, right?
INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 167 Diana is on the phone with one of the Russian thugs. INT. -— HOUSTON BONAVENTURE HOTEL, ROOM - NIGHT 168

If you want boy back, your husband is to deliver five million dollars. You go to police, we will kill boy and tell cops your husband killed a friend of ours. EXT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 169 Lightning flashes. It’s raining. This is how our story began.
Jack sits alone. Rain shadows dance across his face causing odd patterns on his cheeks. It’s as if the night cries the tears he cannot. Michael enters and approaches slowly.
You okay, daddy? Jack can’t speak. He just holds him tightly, runs his fingers through his hair. Then Jack lets go and cups his sons face in his hands.
I need you to do something for me.
Sure.
You keep an eye on mommy. She loves you, you got that?  171 172 173 174 115.
Yeah...sure.

I’m serious...and you need to stay in school. I know it sounds corny, but trust me son, if you have an education, you're unstoppable. Michael nods, trying to take it all in. Jack hugs him again, kisses him, and heads out. INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 171 Jack zips the DUFFLE BAG. Diana holds Adam close to her. He looks to Diana.

I’m gonna get him back, Diana. INT. - JACK’S MERCEDES - NIGHT 172 A SERIES OF SILENT SHOTS...Jack's trip to meet for ransom is intercut with SHOTS of what could have been his life had he never left Houston... INT. - JACK’S HOUSTON HOUSE - NIGHT 173 Jack walks through the driving rain to his car. SINGLE SHOT: Jack with Diana and the kids on a beach...

The ride was long enough for me to think about all that I did to get there...I thought about the years gone by, Diana, the kids...I pictured what my life would have been like had I never met Haggerty out in Vegas...
Jack drives along the freeway towards the Bonaventure. SINGLE SHOT: Jack surveys his LA club...smiles. Business is good.  175 176 177 116.
I thought about love not money...I thought about what money used to mean to me. How I could have been just fine with the club.
Jack rides up in a glass elevator along the side of the building, overlooking the city. It’s all over his face. His thoughts are racing.
I thought about big houses and how cold they are, how families need to pass each other once in a while in the hallway, families need to eat together at night...

Jack moves down the hallway to the suite carrying the duffle bag. He pushes the door open. The door opens revealing a Russian THUG who lets Jack in. SINGLE SHOT: Jack's son Michael throws him a ball, he turns off the computer and goes outside with him.

I thought about how underrated family is. INT. -— HOUSTON BONAVENTURE HOTEL, ROOM - NIGHT 177 The suite has lots of windows and glass, overlooking the city. Rain pounds against it as lightning intermittently lights up the room.

I expected to see the Russians first. If not them, at least Buck and Wayne. But instead... Haggerty sits on the sofa puffing a huge Cuban cigar, blowing smoke rings. Jack takes a few steps forward and places the suitcase down.
Why aren't I surprised?  117. Haggerty laughs.
Because you’re a smart guy, Jack. And you always were a lucky guy, too. Until now. Now the luck runs out for you. (re: duffle bag) I take it that’s the money?
Hey, let’s focus on why we’re here. You don’t get shit from me until that kid is well out of here.

Of course, of course. We’re not animals Jack. This is strictly business. The money’s not for me anyway Jack, it’s for him. Nikita moves over with two more thugs. He speaks in Russian to them. They open a bathroom door. Alejandro appears, spots Jack, and rushes over to him. He hugs Jack. Jack protectively brings him over to the door to the hall and opens it.

(in Spanish) Go there (pointing to the HOTEL ROOM DOOR ACROSS THE HALL). You will be safe. Alejandro takes off across the hall where James opens the hotel room door. Jack shuts his door and goes back into the room.
Thanks for not hurting him. Jack takes the duffle bag and places it on the table. Nikita unzips it and does a quick count of the money.
Why did you kill Ivan? Jack turns. Buck and Wayne are standing off in the corner. They look like two nervous school boys.
I didn’t kill him. It was an accident. Ask them. They were there.  118.
Hey, fuck that! We had nothing to do with it! That nigger bouncer punched him. Once. Right? He died.

He threatened my family. I didn’t want it to go down that way. I doubt that this helps, but I truly am sorry. Before Jack can get another word out, one of the thugs clocks Jack across the face, just like Ivan. Jack staggers back and falls to the floor. Nikita nods his satisfaction.
Easy. We don’t want him signing these contracts under duress. Jack slowly gets to his feet.
Did you say something about signing?
That’s right. Jack looks around the room at everyone.
Signing what? Haggerty gets up and moves over to the dining room table, where he produces a contract. He holds up a pen.
Come on, Jack. Let’s get it over with. We gave you the kid, sign this and everybody's friends.
What the hell am I signing?

Everything. Everything away to us. The business. To me, Nikita, Buck and Wayne. Jack stares at everyone in the room. Jack nods slowly. He moves over to the table and takes the pen from Haggerty.  119. Everyone gathers around as Jack signs his name. As he does, a drop of blood falls from Jack’s nose and lands on the paper. Nikita slowly raises his gun. Jack closes his eyes, awaiting his fate. Haggerty starts laughing. HAGGERTY (CONT’D) I can’t believe this! I mean, straight up, I just can’t believe this!
